prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0, 0, -90] and the translation vector to [0, 0.75, 0]. This will position the part at the appropriate location and orientation for the overall assembly. Now, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 with the following curves: 1. Line 1: Start point [0, 0]; End point [0.15, 0] 2. Line 2: Start point [0.15, 0]; End point [0.15, 0.1875] 3. Line 3: Start point [0.15, 0.1875]; End point [0, 0.1875] 4. Line 4: Start point [0, 0.1875]; End point [0, 0] These curves form a closed loop, creating a quadrilateral on the XY plane. Now, let's extrude the sketch. Set the extrude depth towards normal to 0.75 and opposite normal to 0. This will create a solid rectangular prism with one flat face and a curved side, with dimensions as described in the JSON. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end, resembling a metallic rod or tube. Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to [0, 0, -90] and the translation vector to [0.0163, 0, 0.0375]. This will position the part at the appropriate location and orientation for the overall assembly. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 with the following curve: 1. Circle 1: Center [0.0562, 0.0562]; Radius 0.0562 This will create a circle in the XY plane. Now, let's extrude the sketch. Set the extrude depth towards normal to 0 and opposite normal to 1.125. This will create a solid cylindrical shape with a tapered end. Part 3: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Create a new coordinate system for part 3. Set the Euler angles to [0, 0, 0] and the translation vector to [0.0711, 0.5663, 0.1875]. This will position the part at the appropriate location and orientation for the overall assembly. Now, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 with the following curves: 1. Line 1: Start point [0, 0]; End point [0.0037, 0] 2. Line 2: Start point [0.0037, 0]; End point [0.0037, 0.15] 3. Line 3: Start point [0.0037, 0.15]; End point [0, 0.15] 4. Line 4: Start point [0, 0.15]; End point [0, 0] These curves form a closed loop, creating a quadrilateral on the XY plane with a small gap on one side. Now, let's extrude the sketch. Set the extrude depth towards normal to 0 and opposite normal to 0.0334. This will create a solid rectangular prism with a small cylindrical hole in the center, with dimensions as described in the JSON. This concludes the step-by-step instructions for creating the 3D CAD model based on the provided JSON data.</description>
